      • resourceGetAbsolutePath

        public static java.lang.String resourceGetAbsolutePath(java.lang.String resourcePath)
        Provides an absolute path to a resource runtime, basically translates a classpath into an absolute path. Note: for this to work the resource you are trying to access needs to be either in the resource folder or the class path.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - relative path to the Java resource without the leading forward slash, eg 'folder/file.extension' .
        Returns:
        String absolute path to resource in os.

      • resourceGetAsStream

        public static java.io.InputStream resourceGetAsStream(java.lang.String resourcePath)
        Returns the a runtime resource located in the classpath as a stream.
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - relative path to the Java resource.
        Returns:
        The runtime resource located in the classpath as a stream.

                                                              java.lang.String file)
        Get properties from the classpath.
        Parameters:

        file - Relative filename for the classpath
        Returns:
        Properties object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if file not found or invalid

      • moveResourceToTemporaryDirectory

        public static java.lang.String moveResourceToTemporaryDirectory(java.lang.String resource,
                                                                java.lang.String name)
        Extract a resource from the jar into a temporary directory that will be cleaned out once the program has exited.
        Parameters:
        resource - the relative path to the resource you wish to access from the filesystem
        name - the name of the temporary file in the temporary directory
        Returns:
        the path to the file in the temporary directory

      • overrideSystemProperties

        public static void overrideSystemProperties(org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger,
                                            java.util.Properties properties)
        Iterates through the supplied properties and overrides a property if there exists a system property with the same name. Basically used to override properties set in file with properties specified in commandline/java config.
        Parameters:
        logger - Logger supplied for log output
        properties - overriding properties
